name: Hermetic Tarot Cosmology
displayName: The Tree of Life - Kabbalistic-Hermetic Cosmos
description: The cosmology underlying Western esoteric tarot is the Kabbalistic Tree of Life (Etz Chaim), as interpreted and developed by the Hermetic Order of the Golden Dawn and subsequent magical traditions. This cosmic map depicts reality as a series of emanations flowing from the infinite divine source (Ain Soph) through ten spheres (Sefirot) connected by twenty-two paths, each path associated with a Hebrew letter and a Major Arcana card. The Tree represents both the structure of the universe and the structure of the human soul, following the Hermetic principle 'As above, so below.' Creation occurs through the Lightning Flash - divine energy descending from Keter (Crown) through each successive Sefirah to Malkuth (Kingdom, material world). The spiritual journey reverses this, ascending the Tree through the Serpent Path of initiation and return. The Four Worlds of Kabbalah (Atziluth, Briah, Yetzirah, Assiah) correspond to the four suits of the Minor Arcana and the four elements. This cosmological framework transforms tarot from a mere fortune-telling device into a comprehensive map of consciousness, a meditation tool, and a guide for spiritual evolution. The Major Arcana, when arranged on the Tree's paths, reveals the initiatory journey from material consciousness to divine union - the Great Work of Hermetic alchemy.

threeVeils.name: The Three Veils of Negative Existence
threeVeils.description: Above Keter lie three aspects of the unknowable infinite: Ain (Nothing), Ain Soph (Limitless), and Ain Soph Aur (Limitless Light). These represent the divine before manifestation, beyond human comprehension.

sefirot.name: Keter (Crown)
sefirot.meaning: Divine unity, source of all, first emanation
sefirot.correspondences: Primum Mobile, Aces of all suits

sefirot.name: Tiferet (Beauty)
sefirot.meaning: Harmony, balance, the Self, Christ consciousness

fourWorlds.name: Atziluth (Emanation)
fourWorlds.description: World of archetypes, pure divine fire, the Wands suit

fourWorlds.name: Briah (Creation)
fourWorlds.description: World of creation, archangelic, the Cups suit

fourWorlds.name: Yetzirah (Formation)
fourWorlds.description: World of formation, angelic, the Swords suit

fourWorlds.name: Assiah (Action)
fourWorlds.description: Material world, physical manifestation, the Pentacles suit

paths.description: The 22 paths connecting the Sefirot correspond to the 22 Major Arcana cards and 22 Hebrew letters. Each path represents a specific type of consciousness or experience linking two spheres.

lightningFlash.name: The Lightning Flash of Emanation
lightningFlash.description: Divine energy descending from Keter through each Sefirah to Malkuth, the process of creation. Represents the descent of spirit into matter.

serpentPath.name: The Serpent Path of Return
serpentPath.description: The spiritual journey ascending from Malkuth back to Keter, reversing the Lightning Flash. This is the Great Work of personal and cosmic redemption.

daath.name: Daath (Knowledge)
daath.description: The invisible Sefirah in the Abyss between the Supernal Triad and lower spheres. Represents hidden knowledge, the fall, and the challenge of crossing the Abyss in initiation.

primarySources.title: Sefer Yetzirah (Book of Formation)
primarySources.author: Anonymous
primarySources.description: Early Kabbalistic text on creation through Hebrew letters and numbers

primarySources.title: Zohar (Book of Splendor)
primarySources.author: Moses de Leon (attributed)
primarySources.description: Central text of Kabbalah describing the Sefirot and divine emanation

primarySources.title: The Kabbalah Unveiled
primarySources.author: S.L. MacGregor Mathers
primarySources.description: Golden Dawn founder's translation of key Kabbalistic texts

primarySources.title: The Mystical Qabalah
primarySources.author: Dion Fortune
primarySources.description: Influential practical guide to Kabbalistic working

primarySources.title: 777 and Other Qabalistic Writings
primarySources.author: Aleister Crowley
primarySources.description: Comprehensive correspondence tables linking Tarot, Kabbalah, and other systems

metadata.historicalPeriod: Jewish Kabbalah (12th-16th century), Hermetic Kabbalah (16th century-present), Golden Dawn synthesis (1888-present)
